https://medium.com/@pallavisinha12/build.description: As we know fine-tuning can boost LLM’s capability but at the same time it brings lot of challenges, we can use few techniques like Few shot prompting (in the prompt we mention few user inputs and respective response, LLM would try to learn how to perform the task), Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) etc. Note : We must always build our LLM Application in such a way that it is not coupled with which LLM we are using so that we always have room to use improved LLMs. Step 5: LLM Hosting [If not pre-trained enterprise LLM] If you are not using enterprise pre-trained LLMs and have either fine-tuned by training the LLM or using open source LLM, you will need to host the LLM to a server or cloud infrastructure so that it can be used for inference in your application.
snippets: Build an architecture design showing all the components and their interaction using software designing best practices before starting the actual development. Below is a sample architecture built

As we know fine-tuning can boost LLM’s capability but at the same time it brings lot of challenges, we can use few techniques like Few shot prompting (in the prompt we mention few user inputs and respective response, LLM would try to learn how to perform the task), Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) etc. Note : We must always build our LLM Application in such a way that it is not coupled with which LLM we are using so that we always have room to use improved LLMs. Step 5: LLM Hosting [If not pre-trained enterprise LLM] If you are not using enterprise pre-trained LLMs and have either fine-tuned by training the LLM or using open source LLM, you will need to host the LLM to a server or cloud infrastructure so that it can be used for inference in your application.

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/ar.description: In this paper, we argue that foundation models such as LLMs can be used for creative reasoning tasks in the engineering design process, complementing and integrating existing computational methods such as topology optimization. Using foundation models such as LLMs or pre-trained multi-modal models in the engineering design process is a recent and unexplored topic. We describe how LLMs and multi-modal foundation models can assist in the design discourse and outline interesting directions of research, including structuring of the design discourse in stages and components, the provision of machine-actionable interfaces for specialized engineering software, the development of foundation models with learned representations that better correspond to the skills required in the design process, and the creation and publication of common metrics and datasets as a community effort.
snippets: In this paper, we argue that foundation models such as LLMs can be used for creative reasoning tasks in the engineering design process, complementing and integrating existing computational methods such as topology optimization. Using foundation models such as LLMs or pre-trained multi-modal models in the engineering design process is a recent and unexplored topic. We describe how LLMs and multi-modal foundation models can assist in the design discourse and outline interesting directions of research, including structuring of the design discourse in stages and components, the provision of machine-actionable interfaces for specialized engineering software, the development of foundation models with learned representations that better correspond to the skills required in the design process, and the creation and publication of common metrics and datasets as a community effort.
https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/ar.title: Opportunities for large language models and discourse in engineering design

https://www.zenml.io/blog/llmops-in-prod.description: Voiceflow - Voiceflow, a platform for building chat and voice assistants, implemented a hybrid approach, integrating LLMs via the OpenAI API for generative features while retaining their custom NLU model for intent and entity detection due to its superior performance and cost-effectiveness; they also built an ML Gateway to manage connections to both LLMs and traditional models, and implemented prompt engineering and error handling to address challenges like JSON formatting. The system highlights the importance of model customization, confidence scoring, and production system integration in healthcare LLMOps. Xcel Energy - Xcel Energy deployed a RAG-based chatbot using Databricks’ Data Intelligence Platform to streamline operations like rate case reviews and legal contract analysis, reducing review times from 6 months to 2 weeks.
snippets: Voiceflow - Voiceflow, a platform for building chat and voice assistants, implemented a hybrid approach, integrating LLMs via the OpenAI API for generative features while retaining their custom NLU model for intent and entity detection due to its superior performance and cost-effectiveness; they also built an ML Gateway to manage connections to both LLMs and traditional models, and implemented prompt engineering and error handling to address challenges like JSON formatting. The system highlights the importance of model customization, confidence scoring, and production system integration in healthcare LLMOps. https://www.forbes.com/councils/forbeste.description: My company implemented a generative AI knowledge wiki for claims adjusters, leveraging past data and standard operating procedures to expedite processing and enhance the customer experience. The LLM was trained with Vyopta data, which enabled us to serve many more customers with no increase in team size. Digicert, a digital security company and one of our customers, uses LLM technology and generative AI to answer questions faster and better. Act-On, a marketing automation company, rebuilt its platform with an embedded GenAI analytics solution powered by LLMs. The platform enables users to ask questions about the performance of their marketing campaigns in natural language and receive answers, along with AI-generated insights.

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/ar.description: Initially, we will examine the body of research on the uses of generative AI, going over its unique functions in data analysis, behavior modeling, and social interaction simulation (Caliskan et al., 2017). The effects of generative AI extend to psychological research tools and data analysis, where it automates behavior simulation, emotional analysis, and data production, greatly increasing the effectiveness and accuracy of research (Elyoseph et al., 2024). Artificial intelligence (AI)-generated virtual experiments and simulations provide flexible and controlled research contexts, lowering ethical hazards and increasing the effectiveness of data collecting (Chheang et al., 2024). This study offers a thorough investigation of the uses and effects of generative artificial intelligence (AI) in psychology, highlighting the field's enormous promise in domains like behavior modeling, emotion analysis, mental health care, and customer support.

https://coralogix.com/ai-blog/exploring-.description: Exploring Large Language Models: A Guide to LLM Architectures The Transformer deep learning architecture is a revolutionary milestone in language processing, particularly in the domain of Large Language Models (LLMs). The transformer architecture, renowned as the foremost Large Language Model (LLM) framework, illustrates its versatility and prominence in advancing the capabilities of language-centric AI systems. GPT, or Generative Pre-trained Transformer, represents a category of Large Language Models (LLMs) proficient in generating human-like text, offering capabilities in content creation and personalized recommendations. Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) is an architectural strategy that amplifies the capabilities of large language models (LLMs) by seamlessly integrating real-time, external knowledge into LLM responses.

https://link.springer.com/article/10.100.description: In this paper, we present an approach for the systematic and comprehensive inclusion of ethical considerations in the design and development process of artificial intelligence systems, called Ethics by Design for AI (EbD-AI). The Ethics by Design approach facilitates this by offering a generic model of development into which values have already been translated into AI-specific requirements. It can moreover be contrasted to approaches that do not focus on the design of AI systems specifically, but of information systems more generally, such as value-sensitive design [38] and the IEEE Standard Model Process for Addressing Ethical Concerns during System Design [39]. In this article, we presented an Ethics by Design approach for the development of AI systems, EbD-AI.
snippets: In this paper, we present an approach for the systematic and comprehensive inclusion of ethical considerations in the design and development process of artificial intelligence systems, called Ethics by Design for AI (EbD-AI). The Ethics by Design approach facilitates this by offering a generic model of development into which values have already been translated into AI-specific requirements. It can moreover be contrasted to approaches that do not focus on the design of AI systems specifically, but of information systems more generally, such as value-sensitive design  and the IEEE Standard Model Process for Addressing Ethical Concerns during System Design . In this article, we presented an Ethics by Design approach for the development of AI systems, EbD-AI.
https://link.springer.com/article/10.100.title: Ethics by design for artificial intelligence | AI and Ethics - Springer

https://dexoc.com/blog/ethical-legal-cha.description: Ethical and Legal Challenges in Large Language Model Development: Addressing the Issues and Exploring Solutions Key issues include data privacy, bias, transparency, and compliance. This blog covers these challenges and offers solutions, from privacy-preserving techniques to bias audits and regulatory compliance, to ensure responsible AI development. Furthermore, bias-related issues pose reputational and legal risks if the model’s behavior is found to violate anti-discrimination laws or ethical guidelines. Governments and regulatory bodies are still developing frameworks to address the ethical and legal implications of LLMs. Companies that fail to comply with emerging regulations risk legal penalties, reputational damage, and even shutdowns in specific regions. By focusing on data privacy, fairness, transparency, and compliance, organizations can create LLMs that align with ethical standards and legal requirements.

https://www.metadialog.com/blog/ai-and-l.description: The field of UX design is seeing a notable transformation due to the introduction of a new artificial intelligence technology called large language models (LLMs). Today, we’ll touch on how the LLM UX is changing user experience and offer you the tips you need to thrive. With the increasing demand for revolutionary AI products, UI/UX designers are exploring new tech: LLMs. They are advanced GenAI models integrated into UX to amp up interactions, offer tailored responses, and spruce up user experience. UX designers get an opportunity to create brand-new experiences — both visually appealing and responsive to user needs. In summary, UX designers can create intelligent, user-centered experiences that completely transform a brand’s digital face. LLMs provide UX experts with many insights into user behavior, preferences, and needs.

https://a16z.com/emerging-architectures-.description: There are many different ways to build with LLMs, including training models from scratch, fine-tuning open-source models, or using hosted APIs. The stack we’re showing here is based on in-context learning, which is the design pattern we’ve seen the majority of developers start with (and is only possible now with foundation models). Startups like Steamship provide end-to-end hosting for LLM apps, including orchestration (LangChain), multi-tenant data contexts, async tasks, vector storage, and key management. The tools and patterns we’ve laid out here are likely the starting point, not the end state, for integrating LLMs. We’ll update this as major changes take place (e.g., a shift toward model training) and release new reference architectures where it makes sense.
